newsitem.title: USA: Kmart names Super Kmart president.
newsitem.headline: Kmart names Super Kmart president.

text.p: Kmart Corp said Wednesday Laurence Anderson, 55, will become president of Super Kmart and executive vice president of the company, effective August 18 and reporting to Kmart chairman Floyd Hall.

Anderson recently retired from SuperValu Inc where he served most recently as executive vice president/president and chief operating officer of retail food companies. In that role he was responsible for seven companies operating four different retail formats including Cub Foods, Shop N Save and Biggs Supercenters.
Anderson replaces Ronald Floto, who resigned in May as executive vice president of Kmart and president of Super Kmart.

"Larry Anderson is highly regarded throughout the food industry and will bring great leadership strength to our Super Kmart division," Hall said in a statement. "His outstanding experience in procurement, wholesaling, distribution and retail food operations will be valuable assets as we continue to expand and improve our super center business."
Kmart has 2,122 Kmart and Super Kmart retail outlets in the United States.
